definition: to set a time limit/time limit/deadline
limit/bound/to set a limit (on)
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]
unlimited (time) duration
grace period/period of grace

sentences.english: It's proving very difficult to peg him down to a definite date for completion.
sentences.chinese: 要規定他限期完成確是十分困難的。

sentences.english: Prevenient grace, therefore, is a process.
sentences.chinese: 前的寬限期，因此，是一個過程。

sentences.english: An application is unresponsive or hangs indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 應用程序無響應或無限期懸掛。

sentences.english: In July, a federal judge indefinitely enjoined publication of the book.
sentences.chinese: 7月，一名聯邦法官無限期地禁止了此書的出版。

sentences.english: Drivers have ten days' grace to renew their licenses.
sentences.chinese: 駕駛員更換執照有10天的寬限期。

sentences.english: The Government has indefinitely deferred the Tamar development project.
sentences.chinese: 政府決定無限期押後添馬艦的發展工程。

sentences.english: Rising prosperity alone will not placate people indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 僅僅是繁榮昌盛不足以無限期地安撫民衆。

sentences.english: Junior and middle-ranking civil servants have pledged to join the indefinite strike.
sentences.chinese: 基層和中層公務員已承諾要加入到無限期罷工中來。

sentences.english: She knew well that a woman's vis. t is. apt to spin itself out for an indeterminate time.
sentences.chinese: 她很清楚，一個女人作客很容易無限期地延續下去。

sentences.english: Confirm that they can meet these new deadlines.
sentences.chinese: 確認他們可以在新的限期前完成供給。

sentences.english: We regret to inform you that you are being furloughed indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 我們遺憾地通知您，您將要無限期地在家待崗。

sentences.english: The opportunity will not remain open indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 這個機會不會無限期地敞開。

sentences.english: He warns the delay cannot go on indefinitely.
sentences.chinese: 他警告說，北韓不能無限期地拖延下去。

sentences.english: Emphasize the importance of deadlines and tasks.
sentences.chinese: 強調限期內完成工作的重要性。

sentences.english: McKinsey has put Mr. Kumar on an indefinite leave of absence.
sentences.chinese: 麥肯錫已經要求庫馬爾無限期休假。

sentences.english: On that occasion he was taken to Val-de-Grace.
sentences.chinese: 在那次會議上他被帶到纈沙坦日寬限期。

definition: to order/to enjoin/to charge/to instruct sb to finish sth
time limit
time limit/deadline/allotted time
to reform/to rectify and improve
to expire/to run out/to come to an end
deadline/final time limit (for project)
on schedule/on time
to charge (an entity) with (a task)/to assign (sb) the task of
the end of fixed period in office/expiration of a term
to be overdue/to fail to meet a deadline/to be behind in doing sth
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
to report, requesting approval/written request for instructions
responsible person/coordinator
to return (sth borrowed etc)/to send back/to refund/to rebate
to close a case/to bring a case to a close (law)
grace period/period of grace
